alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:11PM EDT until March 30 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Kosciusko, Marshall, Starke, Pulaski and Fulton IN Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Ora. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river is at flood stage...significant lowland and rural flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday /7:45 PM CDT Friday/ the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 12.4 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
